data.title: Duminku Mintoff KUOM (1916-2012)

Karmenu Mifsud Bonnici

Biography

Duminku Mintoff KUOM is Notable.

Duminku Mintoff was a Maltese Socialist politician, architect, and civil engineer who was leader of the Labour Party from 1949 to 1984

The son of Lawrence Mintoff and Concetta Farrugia.

Political Career

Active in the Labour Party from 1935 he was first elected to office in 1945 to the Government Council.

In 1945 he was elected as Deputy Leader of the Labour Party and in 1947 appointed Deputy Prime Minister.

In 1955 he was elected Prime Minister, at the time Malta was still a British Colony.

Following independence he was again elected Prime Minister in 1971 holding office until 1984.

Resigning from office in 1984 he retained his Parliamentary seat moving to the back benches.

He resigned from political life in 1988.

Honours

Companion of Honour of the National Order of Merit (1990)

Malta Self-Government Re-introduction Seventy-Fifth Anniversary Medal (1996)

Malta Independence Fiftieth Anniversary Medal (2014)

Order of the Republic of Libya (1971)

Grand Cordon of the Order of the Republic of Tunisia (1973)

Grand Cordon of the Order of Ouissam Alaouite (1978)
